snippet: The city’s Contemporary Arts Center is devoting all three floors of its galleries to the show, “Adam Pendleton: Becoming Imperceptible.”
abstract: Robin Pogrebin Inside Art column; Contemporary Arts Center show Adam Pendleton: Becoming Imperceptible explores African-American issues reminiscent of New Orleans post-Hurricane Katrina; auction houses Sotheby’s and Christie's will trade employees once respective noncompete agreements are fulfilled; Adam Gordon first solo exhibit Tiernan opens at Chapter NY; gallerist Paul Kasmin brings work Disorder: 9 Uneven Angles by French artist Bernar Venet to Union Square; Creative Time names Katie Hollander as executive director.
lead_paragraph: The city’s Contemporary Arts Center is devoting all three floors of its galleries to the show, “Adam Pendleton: Becoming Imperceptible.”

headline.print_headline: Relating Past and Future in New Orleans
headline.main: An Adam Pendleton Exhibition Will Open in New Orleans
